name: Pork Chop Soup
author: Oisín Ó Searcóid
summary: A cheap but tasty, hearty soup that you'll always have seconds of. Serve fresh, with bread if desired.
directions: Place pork chops, paprika, oregano, garlic powder, salt, pepper, chili powder, bay leaf, chicken broth, water, and soy sauce in a large stock pot
Bring to a boil, uncovered, then reduce heat to medium low and let simmer for 1 hour
Remove the pork chops and set aside to cool
Whisk 3/4 cup of the cooking liquid with the flour; set aside
When the pork chops are cool remove and discard any bones or fat
Chop or shred the meat into bite size pieces
Add the potato, broccoli, carrot, onion, celery, and cooked pork back to the pot
Bring the mixture to a boil, stir in the flour mixture
Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour
Remove the bay leaf and gently mash the potatoes before serving
